I read very interesting spoiler inside Reddit. Bran recover Jon’s parentage until Jon and Dany merry with each other. While he knows how important is their reunion. Because they are ice and fire.

Bran tell the true after NK defeat Winterfell and Dany is already pregnant and they are already merried

summary: get to know me meme: [3/10 characters] jon snow “i’m not going to swear an oath i can’t uphold. talk about my father if you...
caption:
get to know me meme: [3/10 characters]

jon snow
“i’m not going to swear an oath i can’t uphold. talk about my father if you want, tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. but when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. then there are no more answers, only better and better lies.”

summary: look at  . Long Way is one of the most important teaser of Game Of Thrones.Why?  there we finally understand who are the bigest...
caption:
look at  .

Long Way is one of the most important teaser of Game Of Thrones.Why?  there we finally understand who are the bigest players of last war.There is two Queen and One King. The most important players of ‘’Game Of Thrones. But this isn’t interesting promo because only for characters. There is similar scenes,similar actions of characters and especially simillar way. but there is something very strange. Just look !!! 

When they start walking towards the throne.Dany and Jon are Similar position. Cersei is different. We can see Dany and Jon’s face. but here is only Cersei’s back. 

Why? Dany and Jon are similar team. Cersei is alone. she is a lier. Because of that we can see her back. Not a face. 

look here. There is different position too 

When they begin to climb the  ladder of Throne . There is Dany and Cersei but where is Jon?  of course he is inside Dany’s team. Jon doesn’t trie to climb on the Throne. Battle will be between Dany and Cersei. Battle of the queens !

Dany and Cersei sit on the throne but Jon is in Winterfel. He will be warden of the North. 

and finaly!!!!!

Cersei is here. breathe cold air and sit the iron throne. 

and Blue eye com with her


This teaser is the bigest spoiler that Dany and Jon are similar team
Thank you.

summary:
Jon, Arya, and Dany Appreciation Week begins tomorrow! 

 For more information on the event, please see here ♥️  Please remember...
body:
Jon, Arya, and Dany Appreciation Week begins tomorrow!

For more information on the event, please see here ♥️ 

Please remember to tag your content with #jadweek and/or #dailyjonaryadany so we can share it. 

However, it’s come to our attention that due to a tumblr issue, posts are sometimes missing from the tags. If that happens to you, please either submit your work directly to the blog or message @aegon​ so we don’t miss it! :) 

We hope this is the first of many more events, and we can’t wait to see everyone’s fantastic work!  ♥️

If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to ask.

blog.name: turtle-paced
blog.title: turtle-paced
blog.description: Writing at the speed of the race course paradox.

summary: GRRM has said that coming back from death "changes" people, and we see in the story how Beric has forgotten many aspects of his...
question: GRRM has said that coming back from death "changes" people, and we see in the story how Beric has forgotten many aspects of his life (like his castle and the lady he was betrothed to) and how Catelyn has become vengeful and murderous. So with that in mind, how do you think Jon will change when he comes back? Do you think he might forget Winterfell or his siblings?
answer:
I think Jon’s big problem upon coming back to life and humanity is going to be an all-consuming indifference to the existential threat humanity is facing. You can’t win, you can’t break even, and you can’t get out of the game…so what’s the point? Jon sure didn’t sign up for seconds at that horrible existential deal, he’s experienced death, and why bother making efforts to avoid it?

This is likely to be combined with his feelings about the mutiny that claimed his life in the first place. (It’s also my speculation that Jon gets kicked out of the Watch following his resurrection.) This isn’t hard to interpret as a rejection of all Jon’s efforts to save the world. So screw them, they can die too, Jon’s past caring.

On top of this, I think he learns about his biological parentage, and the information alienates him from his own sense of identity. I tend to think that reconnecting with his siblings and reaffirming that they are his siblings will be an integral step in Jon overcoming post-resurrection apathy.

reblog.comment:

This isn’t hard to interpret as a rejection of all Jon’s efforts to save the world. So screw them, they can die too, Jon’s past caring.

On top of this, I think he learns about his biological parentage, and the information alienates him from his own sense of identity. I tend to think that reconnecting with his siblings and reaffirming that they are his siblings will be an integral step in Jon overcoming post-resurrection apathy.

trail.content_raw:

On top of this, I think he learns about his biological parentage, and the information alienates him from his own sense of identity. I tend to think that reconnecting with his siblings and reaffirming that they are his siblings will be an integral step in Jon overcoming post-resurrection apathy.
trail.content:
I think Jon’s big problem upon coming back to life and humanity is going to be an all-consuming indifference to the existential threat humanity is facing. You can’t win, you can’t break even, and you can’t get out of the game…so what’s the point? This is likely to be combined with his feelings about the mutiny that claimed his life in the first place. (It’s also my speculation that Jon gets kicked out of the Watch following his resurrection.) This isn’t hard to interpret as a rejection of all Jon’s efforts to save the world. So screw them, they can die too, Jon’s past caring.

On top of this, I think he learns about his biological parentage, and the information alienates him from his own sense of identity. I tend to think that reconnecting with his siblings and reaffirming that they are his siblings will be an integral step in Jon overcoming post-resurrection apathy.
